bug.short_desc: Huawei USB dongle "seen" as USB stick

long_desc.thetext: Hello, A fairly new Huawei USB 3G dongle, this: http://h-node.org/threegcards/view/en/1347/Huawei-Technologies-Co---Ltd- is "seen" as an USB stick and not as a modem. Please add it to the ModemManager database. Best regards, Răzvan
switching from USB to modem is usb_modeswitch's responsibility. Can you provide the output of "dmesg" and "lsusb -v" when you insert the card?
I see the lsusb is already provided by the link, but please add the 'dmesg' output. Thanks!

Hello, Pretty confusingly, the same dongle was reported differently on a second test (done on Trisquel, on a 100% free kernel, as requested by the h-node.org website). However, I was unable to make it work in either case. First test: http://h-node.org/threegcards/view/en/1347/Huawei-Technologies-Co---Ltd- Second test http://h-node.org/threegcards/view/en/709/E398-LTE-UMTS-GSM-Modem-Networkcard The second test contains the dmesg output, as requested abobe. Thanks a lot, Răzvan

This bug appears to have been reported against 'rawhide' during the Fedora 22 development cycle. Changing version to '22'. More information and reason for this action is here: https://fedoraproject.org/wiki/Fedora_Program_Management/HouseKeeping/Fedora22
This Huawei modem is included with the upstream data package since November 2013 (version 20131113).

Fedora 22 changed to end-of-life (EOL) status on 2016-07-19. Fedora 22 is no longer maintained, which means that it will not receive any further security or bug fix updates. As a result we are closing this bug. If you can reproduce this bug against a currently maintained version of Fedora please feel free to reopen this bug against that version. If you are unable to reopen this bug, please file a new report against the current release. If you experience problems, please add a comment to this bug. Thank you for reporting this bug and we are sorry it could not be fixed.
This bug appears to have been reported against 'rawhide' during the Fedora 25 development cycle. Changing version to '25'.
This seems to work now. Please re-open if it doesn't work in Fedora 24 for you. Thank you Lubo
